alert.note: Alert for Inland Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:20AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gulf, southwestern Liberty and northwestern Franklin Counties through 1245 AM EDT/1145 PM CDT/... At 1220 AM EDT/1120 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles northwest of Carrabelle, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stonemill Creek, Wewahitchka, Buck Siding, Morgan Place, Chipola Cutoff, Central City, Beverly, Owens Bridge, Kern, Wilma, Sumatra, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Twin Pole, Dalkeith and Fort Gadsden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
